question: Which cryptocurrency will perform better in November 2021: Bitcoin or Ethereum?
description:
This is the market on the relative change (%) of the USD prices of Bitcoin and Ethereum in the month of November 2021.

To resolve the market, Coingecko's daily prices will be used. The change of prices will be calculated by dividing the closing price of 30 November 2021 by the opening price of 1 November 2021, ie:

ΔB =  [$BTC closing price on November 30] /  [$BTC opening price price on November 1]

ΔE =  [$ETH closing price on November 30]  / [$ETH opening price on November 1]
 
If, after the resolution time (December 1st, 2021, 12:00 PM ET), ΔB is greater than ΔE, this market will resolve to "Bitcoin".

If, after the resolution time (December 1st, 2021, 12:00 PM ET), ΔE is greater than ΔB, this market will resolve to "Ethereum".

If they are exactly equal then the market will resolve 50/50.

----------------------
To resolve the market, Coingecko's historical daily prices will be used and can be seen under "Historical Data" tab on the following sites:
https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/bitcoin/historical_data/usd#panel
https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/ethereum/historical_data/usd#panel )

This market will resolve on the November 30 Close price, which will be the same to December 1 Open price. 

Note also, that the daily open price refers to 30-min candlestick open price at 12 AM in the UTC+0 Time Zone and is also used in the "1y" line chart view.
----------------------

The opening prices for November 1st were:
Bitcoin: $61,471.87
Ethereum: $4,292.04

question: Will Bitcoin ($BTC) price be above $60,000 at noon on November 30, 2021?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Bitcoin (BTC) has a candlestick closing price of $60000.01 or more, as per resolution source, on 30th November 2021, 12pm ET, and “No” otherwise. 

The resolution source for this market will be prices listed on CoinGecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/bitcoin). 

This market will resolve on the “C” (i.e. closing price) listed for the candle titled “Tue 30 November 2021, 12:00:00”, with the “Price” tab selected, in the Eastern Time Zone. Note, this 12:00:00 candle lists the opening price for 11:30:00 PM ET and the closing price for 12:00:00 PM ET. 

The check will be at 12:30 PM ET November 30, 2021.

The check will be at 12:30 PM ET November 30, 2021.

question: Will more than 3.45 million people travel via New York City subway on any day before December 1?
description:
This is a market on NYC subway's daily ridership numbers, determined from MetroCard and OMNY swipes and taps, including ridership on the Staten Island Railway.

If daily subway ridership in New York City is higher than 3,450,000 for any day between November 24 and November 30 2021 (including both), this market resolves to "Yes". Otherwise, this market resolves to "No".

The resolution source for this market is The Metropolitan Transportation Authority Day-by-day ridership numbers (https://new.mta.info/coronavirus/ridership) and it will be checked at daily at 11:30 AM ET.

If the data for any day is not available for any day between November 24 to November 30 inclusive by December 7 for all of the checks, this market resolves 50-50.

question: NBA: Will the Hornets beat the Magic by more than 7.5 points in their 24th November matchup?
description:
In the upcoming NBA game, scheduled for 24th November:

If the Charlotte Hornets win by over 7.5 points, the market will resolve to “Yes”.

If the Orlando Magic lose by less than 7.5 points or win, the market will resolve “No.” 

If the game is not completed by 1st December, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will weekly jobless claims exceed 260K for the week ending on November 27?
description:
This is a market on whether the number of Americans that filed initial jobless claims will exceed 260,000 for the week ending on Saturday, November 27, 2021. 

An initial claim is a claim filed by an unemployed individual after a separation from an employer. The claim requests a determination of basic eligibility for the Unemployment Insurance program.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the United States Department of Labor reports that there were more than 260,000 seasonally adjusted initial claims for unemployment insurance for the week ending on November 27, 2021. 

Otherwise, if this number is equal to or lower than 260,000 this market will resolve to “No”.

The resolution source for this market will be the United States Department of Labor’s Weekly Unemployment Insurance Claims report for the week ending on Saturday, November 27, 2021, expected to be released on Thursday, December 2, 2021, 8:30 AM ET. Resolution of this market will take place upon release of the aforementioned data. 

If data is not available by December 9, 2021, 12:00 PM ET, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will $CRO (Crypto.com Coin) be above $1 on December 1?
description:
This is a market on whether the candlestick close price of $CRO (Crypto.com Coin) will be above $1.00 for the date and time of December 1, 2021, at 11:30 PM ET. 

The resolution source for this market will be prices listed on CoinGecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/crypto-com-coin). 

This market will resolve to “Yes” if, according to the resolution source, $CRO has a candlestick closing price of greater than $1.00 for the resolution date, December 1, 2021, 11:30 PM ET after 11:30 PM ET has passed. 
Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”. 

(To see the candlestick close price, click the candlestick icon, observe the number after the “C:” when you hover over a candlestick for a given time period.)

This market will resolve on the “C” (i.e. closing price) listed for the candle titled “Wed 1 December 2021, 23:30:00” with the “Price” tab selected, in the Eastern Time Zone. Note, this 23:30:00 candle lists the opening price for 11:00:00 PM ET and the closing price for 11:30:00 PM ET. To allow for updates, this market will resolve on the number listed for the referenced candle at exactly 11:50:00 PM ET, on December 1, 2021. 

Note: If the candlestick closing price is exactly $1.00, the market will resolve "No." 

If CoinGecko is unavailable at resolution time, another source will be used.

question: Will MrBeast's Squid Game video reach 60M views in its first week?
description:
This is a market on a public view count of a new video of MrBeast on his Youtube channel. 

According to the creator, his new video will be a "Real life Squid Game with 456 random people competing in exact recreations of every game" and is planned to go public on November 24, 4 PM ET.

The video used for this market will be the first video published on MrBeast's Youtube channel (https://www.youtube.com/c/MrBeast6000/), which refers to Squid Game, after this market's inception time, November 24, 2 PM ET.

This market will resolve to "Yes", if MrBeast's Squid Game has 60,000,000 or more views by the resolution time, December 1, 2021, 4 PM ET, according to the Youtube public view count under the video. Otherwise, it will resolve to "No".

The view count will be checked daily at 4 PM ET to see if 60M views was reached, and finally on the resolution time, December 1st 2021, 4 PM ET. If the data is unavailable then, this market will resolve in a good faith as soon as the data is available.

question: Will the floor price of Chain Runners be above 1.25 ETH on December 2?
description:
This is a market on whether Chain Runners will maintain a price floor over 1.25 ETH on December 2, 2021, at 12:00 PM ET. 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if, on the aforementioned check time, there are no Chain Runners (on https://opensea.io/collection/chain-runners-nft) listed for 1.25 ETH or lower, and “No” otherwise. 

Only listings that have existed for at least an hour are valid for this market. List time for an NFT can be found under “Trading History” by clicking the “Listing” filter and hovering over the date. Note that the exact price at 12:00 PM ET will be used. If no floor price is available at the resolution time, the source will be checked every following hour. 

For valid listings that are declining price auctions, the price exactly at 12:00 PM ET will be used, NOT the price at initial listing time.

question: What will the ETH floor price of Chain Runners be on December 2?
description:
This is a scalar market on what the floor price of Chain Runners will be on December 2, 2021, at 12:00 PM ET. The lower bound for this market is .75 ETH and the upper bound is 2.5 ETH. The resolution source for this market will be prices listed on OpenSea (https://opensea.io/collection/chain-runners-nft). 

Only listings that have existed for at least an hour are valid for this market. List time for an NFT can be found under “Trading History” by clicking the “Listing” filter and hovering over the date. Note that the exact price at 12:00 PM ET will be used. If no floor price is available at the resolution time, the source will be checked every following hour. 

For valid listings that are declining price auctions, the price exactly at 12:00 PM ET will be used, NOT the price at initial listing time. 

You can use the calculator to the right (underneath the Buy modal) to calculate how each Long or Short Token price corresponds with the floor price. Long and Short shares will settle proportionally to the outcome value if the final value is between these bounds, but if the final value exceeds either the upper or lower bound, the price of each Outcome Token is capped at $1 and $0.
